email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is October 15-20. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s ($50.50 per metric ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit higher than expected. Could you consider moving to the mid-40s ($45.50 per metric ton)? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s availability and any demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your position, but the current market is quite tight. However, I can offer a revised rate of $48.75 per metric ton. The MV Ocean Star is still available for the laycan, and the demurrage rate is $25,000 per day, pro-rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised quote. We can agree to $48.75 per metric ton, provided the laycan remains firm and the demurrage terms are as stated. Please confirm the vessel’s readiness and send over the charter party for review. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear that the terms work for you. The MV Ocean Star is confirmed for the laycan of October 15-20, and I’ll send over the charter party shortly. Demurrage remains at $25,000 per day, pro-rata. Let me know if you need anything else. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the confirmation. I’ve reviewed the charter party, and everything looks in order. Let’s proceed with the agreement. Looking forward to a smooth operation. Cheers, John
